title: Find the Common Denominator
text: Do all the terms in the expression have common denominator?
speech: Do all the terms in the expression have common denominator?

title: Find the Common Denominator
text: No, the denominators of terms in the expression are different. We can find the common denominator for both terms. Notice that $$n^2-1=-1\left(1-n^2\right)$$. We can multiply $$\frac{\left(-1\right)}{\left(-1\right)}$$ with $$\frac{n^2-7n-1}{1-n^2}$$. We can rewrite the expression as $$\frac{2n^2+8n-1}{n^2-1}-\left(-\frac{n^2-7n-1}{n^2-1}\right)$$

title: Final Remark
text: Note that the expression (((2n**2)+8*n-1)/(n**2-1))-((n**2-7*n-1)/(1-n**2))) and $$\frac{3n-2}{n-1}$$ are different because the domain of $$\frac{2n^2+8n-1}{n^2-1}-\frac{n^2-7n-1}{1-n^2}$$ does not include $$x=-1$$ and the domain of $$\frac{3n-2}{n-1}$$ does not exclude $$x=-1$$.
